speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Roz!  Uh, I'd join you, but there's not a chair--

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, actually I was just leaving.  You can have mine.

speaker: Roz
text: Niles! [_grabs his arm_] Every time I give you my chair, you wipe it off first.  It's just insulting!

speaker: Niles
text: For your information, I was reaching for my cell phone.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh.  I'm sorry, Niles.  I stepped out of line.  See you later, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye-bye, Roz.

speaker: Waiter
text: Cafe Nervosa.

speaker: Niles
text: [_into phone_] Yes, this is Dr. Crane at Table Seven.  Could you send someone over to dust off my chair?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake!  I'll do it! _He snatches Niles's handkerchief and wipes the chair down. Niles protests, checking out the window for Roz._

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the most ridiculous thing I've seen in my entire life! Stop it, just sit down!

speaker: Niles
text: May I have one of those, please? [_to Frasier_] So, I understand you had a full dance card this weekend?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, indeed.  I met a lovely young artist at the gallery opening on Saturday.  We went out for coffee afterwards, and our date lasted until, well... the cows didn't actually come home, but I did hear mooing on the front porch! [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, I'm drawing a blank.  The only woman I remember you chatting with at the gallery was the one in the Birkenstocks who went on and on about her driftwood collages. [_sniggers_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's Caitlin.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, obviously we seem different on the surface.  But once you get to know her, trust me, she is really a breath of fresh air.  God, I haven't felt this excited about a relationship in ages!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's wonderful, Frasier! [_the waiter brings his coffee_] Thank you.  So, is she from around here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it didn't come up.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I see.  Well, uh, where'd she go to school?

speaker: Frasier
text: She didn't mention it.

speaker: Niles
text: Probably art school.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Being an artist, I'm sure she is enthusiastic about the finer things -- literature, music...

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, I don't know, we never got around to that.

speaker: Niles
text: You know what, I think I'm putting you on the spot here. Let's just leave it at congratulations on your new...

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you implying?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I think we both know what kind of _relationship_ we're talking about.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you stop saying the word "relationship" that way? --

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not condemning you for your little... _fling_ --

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake.

speaker: Niles
text: Just don't try to pass it off as something deeper than it is. The only thing you two have in common is the faint impression of the word "Sealy" on your backsides.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Niles, I would never stay in a relationship if I didn't think there was some real future in it.

speaker: Niles
text: In other words, if you were to realize that the two of you had nothing in common beyond the physical, you'd break it off?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, absolutely!  In a heartbeat!  It's a principle of mine -- you know, this topic comes up all the time on my show.  What do I always say?

speaker: Niles
text: Um...

speaker: Frasier
text: Surely you must listen occasionally!

speaker: Niles
text: Of course I listen occasionally.  It's just I'm usually busy between eleven and one.

speaker: Frasier
text: My show is on from two to five. _FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Apartment Martin and Daphne are in the kitchen.  While Daphne leans out the doorway, Martin places a candle on a cupcake. _

speaker: Martin
text: I can't wait to see the look on his face.

speaker: Daphne
text: Me, too.  He doesn't have a clue.

speaker: Martin
text: [_lights the candle_] Good.  All set. _In the living room, Frasier is setting the table for dinner.  Martin and Daphne come out with the cupcake, singing:_

speaker: Martin/Daphne
text: Happy birthday to you...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God. _They walk past Frasier to Eddie, who is sitting in Martin's Armchair. Martin puts the cupcake in front of Eddie, while Daphne fits a tiny party hat over his head._

speaker: Martin/Daphne
text: Happy birthday, Dear Eddie, Happy birthday to you!

speaker: Martin
text: OK, let's do it together. _He puts his face next to Eddie's and makes a small puff.  The candle goes out._

speaker: Martin
text: Good boy!  Great!  That was terrific!

speaker: Daphne
text: I wonder if he made a wish?

speaker: Frasier
text: I know I did.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.  Dad, Daphne, step lively!  We don't want to miss the previews.

speaker: Martin
text: In a minute.  Come on, birthday boy, I haven't given you your present yet! [_confidentially, to the boys_] I got him a brand-new rubber eeseburger-chay.

speaker: Niles
text: So, Frasier, can we convince you to join us?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I don't think so, Dr. Crane.  Your brother's been slaving away in the kitchen all afternoon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I'm having Caitlin over for dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... for _dinner_.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll thank you to stop with your sniggering insinuations that Caitlin and I share nothing but the physical!  There are many things that we do share. [_opens door_] Caitlin! _Caitlin -- a brunette in her twenties with a decidedly hippie style of dress -- throws her arms around Frasier's neck and kisses him deeply. _

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Daphne_] Now they're sharing a Tic-Tac.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let me take your coat. [_hangs it up_] Oh, you remember Niles, of course.  And this is Daphne, Caitlin.

speaker: Caitlin
text: [_shaking hands_] Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.  Don't worry, we'll be out of your way in a minute, just as soon as I can tear Mr. Crane away from Eddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, he's having a little birthday party for his dog.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh, how old is he?

speaker: Frasier
text: Too old to be having a birthday party for his dog.  Anyway, can I interest you a drink?  I've just opened a bottle of Conte de Bruillet!

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh, you must have been saving it.  Burgogne hasn't made a decent Beaujolais in years.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smugly_] Well, do you hear that, Niles?  Our Caitlin is a fellow oenophile!

speaker: Caitlin
text: When I was little, my father owned a vineyard.   I was the only kid on the block who would open a can of Hawaiian punch and let it breathe!

speaker: Frasier
text: And we share that same quirky sense of humor! [_offers second glass_] Would you care for a glass?

speaker: Caitlin
text: No thanks.  Actually, I've always hated the taste of wine.

speaker: Niles
text: Finally, something I can use to tell you two apart. [_takes the glass_]

speaker: Frasier
text: A martini, then?

speaker: Caitlin
text: I cut out alcohol last year, along with processed sugar, dairy products and meat... Oh, I hope I'm not screwing up your menu! What are you serving?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, so far, parsley.  But we'll make do.  Let me get you a glass of mineral water.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, help yourself to the melon slices.  Just... unwind the prosciutto.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I owe you an apology.  You two are perfectly compatible.  How long will it be before we're all standing outside a wedding chapel, pelting you both with whole-grain brown rice?

speaker: Frasier
text: Spare me your sarcasm.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, come on.  Let me have my fun.  You're certainly having yours, even if you deny that that's what you're doing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I've already told you, I would never continue in a relationship if I didn't think there was a real future, and I happen to believe that there is in this one!  Have you ever heard of "opposites attracting?"  Where I am worldly, Caitlin is... unspoiled.

speaker: Niles
text: Rather remarkable, given her terror of preservatives. _They come out of the kitchen.  Caitlin is standing with Martin and Daphne._

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh, Frasier, I just met your dad!  Did you know we're both Libras?

speaker: Martin
text: Which explains why I'm so "perky, open-minded, and quick to tears."

speaker: Caitlin
text: And don't forget "Outgoing."

speaker: Martin
text: No, I didn't. [_heads for the door_] All right, everybody coming?

speaker: Caitlin
text: Well, it was nice meeting you all!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, nice to meet you too, Caitlin.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll walk you to the door.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering_] Will you stop smirking!  It's going to take more than a harmless dabbling in astrology to dim the charm of this appealing young woman.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh my God!  This is the coolest chair!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_off Niles' look_] Just get out! _He pushes Niles out and closes the door.  FADE TO:_ **DON JUAN IN HELL** _Scene Three -- Frasier's Apartment The next morning.  Frasier is sitting on the piano bench, nursing a cup of coffee.  He looks preoccupied.  Martin comes out. _

speaker: Martin
text: Morning, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: What's the matter?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's Caitlin.  I'm in hell.  Last night I experienced the most intense physical pleasure I've ever known.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, before you continue, I shared my bed last night with a dog.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's not the problem, Dad.  It's just that there's absolutely no future for me and Caitlin.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I got to say I never thought there was.  She's a flake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's not the point.  Granted, there are aspects of her personality that I find off-putting--

speaker: Martin
text: Like her being a flake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right!  It's just difficult to walk away from something so intoxicating.

speaker: Martin
text: Fras, I'm just gonna say one thing: watch out for this woman. I know how these things work.

speaker: Frasier
text: You've experienced something like this?

speaker: Martin
text: I didn't say that.  I just know the type.  Today she's got you going against your better judgment.  Pretty soon, you'll be thinking about her all the time -- losing sleep, missing work, neglecting your friends... [_drifting off_] and then pretty soon you'll get caught naked with her in the backseat of your squad car... [_snaps back_] But anyway, the point is, the longer you put this thing off, the harder it's going to be to end it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're absolutely right, Dad.  Got to nip this thing in the bud.  I'm going to go over there right now.  Doing anything else would just make me a hypocrite. [_gets up and heads for the door_] You know, just yesterday I dedicated an entire theme show to the importance of self-control.

speaker: Martin
text: You did?

speaker: Frasier
text: Doesn't _anybody_ listen? _FADE TO:  Scene Four -- Caitlin's Apartment Frasier stands outside Caitlin's door.  He hesitates for a moment, then sighs and knocks. _

speaker: Caitlin
text: [_o.s._] Who is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Frasier.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh my God!  Why didn't you call first?  Oh, I'm working on one of my collages.  I'm covered in paint, I've got turpentine in my hair, I'm all sweaty--

speaker: Frasier
text: It'll only take a moment, I need to talk to you about something.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh, all right.  But be nice!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I... [_chuckles_] Good lord, you really do look... [_whispering_] Good lord! _They grab each other and kiss passionately.  Still hanging on to her, he stumbles inside and slams the door.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- Frasier's Apartment Evening: Daphne opens the door to Roz, who's carrying some files. _

speaker: Roz
text: Daphne, is Frasier here?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, he's not back yet.

speaker: Roz
text: He was supposed to meet me at the Cafe over an hour ago to finish this paperwork!  Now he can just do it himself. [_drops it on the table_] Can I use your powder room?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, of course. _Roz goes into the powder room.  Niles comes out of the kitchen with a tray of wine glasses._

speaker: Niles
text: Obviously Frasier's attempt to break up with Caitlin has gone awry again.  Thanks to him I have missed the wine tasting. What kind of weak-willed man allows a woman to come between him and a 1981 Cheval Blanc?

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, just out of curiosity, why didn't you go by yourself instead of sit here with me for half an hour?

speaker: Niles
text: I was worried about him, Daphne, worried sick. _Daphne nods and turns around.  Niles smells her hair yet again. Frasier comes in the front door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh...

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, were you at Caitlin's all this time?

speaker: Frasier
text: Heavens, no!  I, uh, I stopped by early this morning.  We've decided to go our separate ways.  And then, I, uh, met up with Roz, went over some paperwork...

speaker: Frasier
text: You know how she is these days.  You know, get her on one of her troubles and yak-yak-yak-yak-yak!

speaker: Frasier
text: And yet she makes every story so interesting I could listen to her for hours...

speaker: Roz
text: Knock it off, Frasier.  Where have you been?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, where do you think I've been?  Trying to break up with Caitlin!  But did I do it?  No!  And why?  Because I'm Frasier, and I'm a sex-oholic!

speaker: Roz
text: It's obvious what's happening here.  You are having a purely sexual fling.  It happens to all of us at some time in our lives.  The one where the chemistry is perfect?  Where you can't even be alone together in a room without tearing each other's clothes off and jumping each other -- I mean, does this sound familiar?

speaker: Frasier/Daphne
text: Yes...

speaker: Niles
text: [_a second too late_] Yeah...

speaker: Daphne
text: Everyone's had a relationship like that!  I know I have. His name was... no, I can't tell you!

speaker: Daphne
text: It's too embarrassing!

speaker: Niles
text: We're all friends here, we're trying to help Frasier.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, well, it was so long ago, I don't even remember all the details.

speaker: Niles
text: Take a minute.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well... it all started one afternoon when I was sunbathing on the roof of our building.  I was concerned about tan lines in those days.  So, I decided to unhook my bikini top-- [_phone rings_] I'll get it.

speaker: Roz
text: Gosh, mine was this lifeguard.  He had long blond hair and the bluest eyes.  He used to get so sunburned, I'd spend hours just peeling the skin off his back.  What was his name?  Rick?  Nick!  I know there was an "ick" sound.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was about to make one of those myself.

speaker: Daphne
text: My mother picks the worst times to call.  Did I miss anything?

speaker: Niles
text: No, nothing.  I believe you were starting to tell us a story?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh yeah, that's right.  Well, once I got my top off, I started thinking to myself, "You know, I've never had an all-over tan."  So, I looked about to see if I was still alone, then I started to slip off my-- [_oven timer dings_] Oh, the rolls are done.

speaker: Roz
text: We haven't heard anything from you, Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't think we're exactly in Niles's wheelhouse! [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, Niles, I've heard your stories.  They're not the steamiest stuff.

speaker: Niles
text: Obviously you've forgotten the semester I spent living in Paris.  I'll have you know I had a torrid affair with a married woman.

speaker: Roz
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Niles.  I had no idea.

speaker: Niles
text: It's not something I boast about.  The attraction was simply overpowering.  Every Thursday, two o'clock, the Hotel De Boulogne.  We'd arrive separately, climb the stairs, open the door... _Ooh-la-la_.  Oh, what an embrace!  Afterwards, she'd whisper to me, "There's something so sweet in your eyes, and it"--

speaker: Frasier
text: "Does me so much good," said Emma Bovary!  If you're going to steal a love life, don't steal from the classics, you imbecile!

speaker: Niles
text: The part about being in Paris is true.

speaker: Daphne
text: Here we are!  Got them out of the oven just in time.  Another minute and I would have had burned buns.

speaker: Niles
text: Which brings us back to your story!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, there I was wearing nothing but a smile, when the sun started to shift.  So I moved behind the water tower, and who was lying there but Derek -- the good-looking fireman from across the hall?  Who was also getting an all-over tan, I might add!  So, I had two choices.  I could either tiptoe away or-- [_kettle whistles_] Tea.

speaker: Niles
text: [_exploding out of his seat_] No, sit!  My God, must Daphne do

speaker: Roz
text: I'll get it.  I could use a glass of ice water anyway.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're not the only one.  Let me give you a hand. _In the kitchen, Roz turns down the stove, then gets a bottle of mineral water from the refrigerator._

speaker: Roz
text: So, is any of this helping?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not much.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, I've got to make a point here.  For as long as I've known you, you've been complaining about your lack of a sex life.  Suddenly, you have one.  So why are you still complaining?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it just seems wrong.  I've thought a lot about this--

speaker: Roz
text: Ah, that's your problem.  You've thought too much about this. You know, why don't you just stop listening to your head and start listening to your body?  You're obviously enjoying this.  Why do you have to feel so guilty?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's just that I'm afraid I have no future with her.

speaker: Roz
text: So?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe she thinks that she has a future with me!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, then it would be wrong.  But is that how she feels?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.

speaker: Roz
text: Ask her.  If she feels the same way you do, you should just enjoy yourself.  These things don't come around very often, and they don't last when they do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're right.  Over-thinking things can certainly spoil anything.  You know, it's funny, I gave the very same advice the other day on my show to that lawyer from Bainbridge.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't remember that.

speaker: Frasier
text: You were five feet away!  Doesn't _anyone_ listen?!

speaker: Daphne
text: And it wasn't until afterwards that we realized we'd rolled onto the skylight above the main stairwell! [_laughs_] Oh, we took some ribbing about that, we did! _Niles is silent.  Very slowly, and with every movement requiring excruciating control, he gets up from the couch, walks to the door, and leaves the apartment without saying a word.  FADE TO:_ **OF MICE AND WOLFMEN** _Scene Five -- Caitlin's Apartment Caitlin's modestly furnished loft.  The lights are off, and candles softly illuminate the room.  Frasier sits in an easy chair.  Caitlin comes out of the kitchen and nuzzles him. _

speaker: Caitlin
text: Well, I think I got everything under control.  Dinner should be ready in about twenty minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Smells wonderful.

speaker: Caitlin
text: So do you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Caitlin, you know...

speaker: Caitlin
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I wanted to ask you: where do you see this going?

speaker: Caitlin
text: Well, right now I'm heading to your earlobe, but if you'd care to reroute me, I'm open to suggestions--

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckles_] No, I mean our relationship.  We've never talked about it.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh.  Gee, I don't know.  I guess I was kind of looking at this as a nice casual thing.  I hope that doesn't disappoint you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not at all, I'm actually relieved!  I-I've been loving things the way they are too.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Yeah, we're just having some fun, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right -- oh well, "fun" doesn't begin to describe it!  I just wanted to make sure we were both on the same page.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Is that what's been on your mind?  Because I thought you were tense these last few days.  I even went and got some hot oil to give you a massage.  But I guess we won't be needing that now.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_naughtily_] Well, I have been terribly worried about this global warming situation.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh well, we've got time before dinner!  I'll go get the oil!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so glad we had this conversation!

speaker: Caitlin
text: [_o.s._] Yeah, me too!  I mean, I was starting to worry that you were scared off by my lifestyle.  I mean, I'm pretty out there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Caitlin, Caitlin, I'm not as narrow-minded as all that. You know, I think we have a wonderful chemistry.  That's enough to offset a few minor differences.

speaker: Caitlin
text: You can be taking your shirt off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh! [_starts unbuttoning it_] Same goes, by the way!  You know, I just love these converted loft spaces.  I wonder what this one was before you moved in? [_looks up_] Judging by these meat hooks -- a slaughterhouse, huh?

speaker: Caitlin
text: No, I put those in.  It was a day-care center.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you artists and your whimsical decorating touches! [_takes off his shirt and sits on the bed_] That's a mousetrap, isn't it?  You get many mice?

speaker: Caitlin
text: I wish!  I use them in my art. Fraiser: [_more fazed_] Dead mice?

speaker: Caitlin
text: Yeah, they're part of my newest collage series.  It's all about mortality. _Frasier nervously squeezes a pillow.  Caitlin comes out, naked underneath a robe.  Her hair is now cropped short, and she's carrying her shorn tresses in her hands._

speaker: Frasier
text: Caitlin... you've cut your hair!

speaker: Caitlin
text: Yeah, sometimes the spirit just grabs me, and I've got to do it!  It's really very freeing.  Plus I think there's something great about using your body parts for practical use.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's uh... it's different!  It's still beautiful, nonetheless.  Is that all your hair?

speaker: Caitlin
text: It's mostly mine.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Caitlin, I'm thinking--

speaker: Caitlin
text: No, no, no, don't think! [_turns him around and sits him on the chair_] The secret to a good massage is to let the mind rest, and listen to the body.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Yeah...

speaker: Frasier
text: OK.  Go ahead, Body... I'm listening.

speaker: Caitlin
text: Mmm...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, yeah, that feels good.

speaker: Caitlin
text: You know, if we moved to the bed, I could give you a more thorough massage. _Frasier stands up and goes to the bed, dropping his trousers to the floor._

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh, I just remembered, it's a full moon tonight!

speaker: Caitlin
text: Look!  Isn't that beautiful?

speaker: Frasier
text: How romantic.  You know, there's nothing like a full moon to make one--

speaker: Frasier
text: Caitlin?

speaker: Caitlin
text: I'm a member of the lycanthrope society.

speaker: Frasier
text: As in... werewolf?

speaker: Caitlin
text: Not literally.  It's a group of women who believe that the moon controls our cycles, and this is our way of paying our respects.

speaker: Caitlin
text: [_cattily_] Besides, you've heard me howl before.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, but in that context I took it as a compliment!

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh, Frasier, you're getting all tense again.  It's the hair pillows, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that--

speaker: Caitlin
text: Oh, got one!

speaker: Frasier
text: Among other things!

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Caitlin, I'm starting to think that maybe this isn't such a good idea!

speaker: Caitlin
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, we're just so different!  You know, I'm basically your stuffy, buttoned-down sort of guy!  You're, well, you're your free-spirited, adventurous, mouse- painting, moon-howling sort of girl!  Is even the most satisfying sexual relationship enough to bridge that gap?

speaker: Caitlin
text: Well, I think so.

speaker: Caitlin
text: What do you think? _Frasier stares... then lets out a wolf howl.  From a ground-level view, we see the rest of their clothes drop to the floor as they fall together onto the bed._
